sen.j: 富樫 稙泰（とがし たねやす 文明 (日本)6年（1474年）? - 天文 (元号)4年（1535年））は富樫氏16代当主（高家の代から数えての数）。
sen.e: Taneyasu TOGASHI (1474? - 1535) was the 16th family head of Togashi clan (number of generations since the period in which the family was designated as koke [privileged family under Tokugawa Shogunate]).
sen.cmt: 高家→koke (privileged family under Tokugawa Shogunate)としましたが、高家にはa master of ceremonyの意味もあるようです。
sen.e: Taneyasu TOGASHI (1474? - 1535) was the 16th family head of Togashi clan (number of generations since Takaie TOGASHI).
sen.cmt: koke → Ｔａｋａｉｅ TOGASHI ここでは富樫高家のことのようです。
sen.e: Taneyasu TOGASHI (1474? - 1535) was the 16th family head of Togashi clan (number of generations since Takaie TOGASHI).
He was the son of Yasunari TOGASHI.
He was the son of Yasunari TOGASHI.
He was the son of Yasunari TOGASHI.
His pseudonym was Jiro
His pseudonym was Jiro
His pseudonym was Jiro

sen.j: 父・富樫泰成が早世した為、祖父・富樫泰高の跡を継ぐ。
sen.e: As his father, Yasunari TOGASHI, died young, he succeeded to the family head after his grandfather, Yasutaka TOGASHI.
As his father, Yasunari TOGASHI, died young, he succeeded to the family head after his grandfather, Yasutaka TOGASHI.
As his father, Yasunari TOGASHI, died young, he succeeded to the family head after his grandfather, Yasutaka TOGASHI.

sen.j: 室町幕府10代征夷大将軍・足利義稙の偏諱で恒泰から稙泰とした。
sen.e: He changed his name to Taneyasu from Tsuneyasu, when he was granted to use a portion (in this case 'tane' written in Chinese character 稙) of the real name of Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, the 10th Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of Muromachi bakufu (Japanese government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 恒泰→Tsuneyasu、足利義稙→Yoshitane ASHIKAGA と偏諱にあたる部分に下線を付しました。また、その部分については、a portion (in this case 'tane' written in Chinese character 稙)と漢字表記をと加えました。
sen.e: He changed his name to Taneyasu from Tsuneyasu, when he was granted to use a portion (in this case 'tane' written in Chinese character 稙) of the real name of Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, the 10th Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of Muromachi bakufu (Japanese government headed by a shogun).

He changed his name to Taneyasu from Tsuneyasu, when he was granted to use a portion (in this case 'tane' written in Chinese character 稙) of the real name of Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, the 10th Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of Muromachi bakufu (Japanese government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 1531年、亨禄の錯乱にて小一揆方の味方をした為、大一揆方に敗れて加賀守護の地位を追われた。
sen.e: In 1531, as he supported the Sho-ikki side (a moderate uprising group formed by three temples in Kaga Province) during the Kyoroku Disturbance, he was expelled from the post of the constable of Kaga Province), when Sho-ikki side lost in the disturbance.
sen.cmt: 小一揆方→定訳不明：Sho-ikki side (a moderate uprising group formed by temples in Kaga Province) としました。
sen.e: In 1531, as he supported the Sho-ikki side (a moderate uprising group formed by three temples in Kaga Province) during the Kyoroku Disturbance, he was expelled from the post of the constable of Kaga Province), when Sho-ikki side lost in the disturbance.

In 1531, as he supported the Sho-ikki side (a moderate uprising group formed by three temples in Kaga Province) during the Kyoroku Disturbance, he was expelled from the post of the constable of Kaga Province), when Sho-ikki side lost in the disturbance.

sen.j: これにより守護・富樫家の権威は完全に失墜してしまい、本願寺が本格的に領国内調停者の地位を確立した。
sen.e: Since then, the authority of the provincial constable family, Togashi family, had fallen down completely, and instead, Hongan-ji Temple established the position of mediator exclusively in the entire province.

Since then, the authority of the provincial constable family, Togashi family, had fallen down completely, and instead, Hongan-ji Temple established the position of mediator exclusively in the entire province.

Since then, the authority of the provincial constable family, Togashi family, had fallen down completely, and instead, Hongan-ji Temple established the position of mediator exclusively in the entire province.

sen.j: 子の富樫晴貞が跡を継いだ。
sen.e: His son Harusada TOGASHI succeeded to the family.
His son Harusada TOGASHI succeeded to the family.
His son Harusada TOGASHI succeeded to the family.
Posthumous Buddhist name: Taiunji Dentsuan (泰雲寺殿通安).
sen.cmt: 泰雲寺殿通安→定訳不明・正式な読み方が不明です：Taiunji Dentsuan (泰雲寺殿通安)としました。
sen.e: Posthumous Buddhist name: Taiunji Dentsuan (泰雲寺殿通安).
Posthumous Buddhist name: Taiunji Dentsuan (泰雲寺殿通安).
